p: This study was carried out in Sinop city (11°50′53′′ S and 55°38′57′′ W), located 503 km north of the Mato Grosso state capital of Cuiabá, Midwest Brazil. The city was established in 1974, inside the Amazon rainforest, and today, it has an estimated population of 139,935 inhabitants. Sinop is situated in a transitional zone between the Amazon rainforest and Cerrado (Savannah) biomes. The region has a tropical climate, with a dry season of six months, and an average temperature of 26 °C and precipitation levels of over 2500 mm.
